Introduction

Mark Tuan (born Tuan Yi-Eun) is an American singer and rapper of Taiwanese descent. He is best known as a member of the boy group GOT7, which debuted under JYP Entertainment on January 16, 2014, with the single "Girls Girls Girls." Before his debut, he trained under JYP after moving to South Korea in 2010.

Following the expiration of his contract in 2021, Mark and his bandmates left JYP Entertainment to pursue solo and group activities. He has since continued his music career under the stage name Mark Tuan, releasing new music independently. In the same year, he established a studio in Beijing, China, to focus on solo promotions.

Mark officially debuted as a soloist in January 2020 with the digital single "Outta My Head" and later collaborated with Sanjoy Deb on "One in a Million" (February 12, 2021). On April 29, 2021, he signed with Creative Artists Agency to expand his career globally.
